title: Arrangement of the Camp
summary: Numbers 2 describes how the tribes of Israel were to camp around the tabernacle. Each tribe had a specific position, with three tribes forming a group on each side: east, south, west, and north.

faq.question: Where did the tabernacle sit in the camp?
faq.answer: At the center of the camp, symbolizing Godâ€™s presence among His people.

faq.question: Why were the tribes arranged in this way?
faq.answer: To maintain order and symbolize God's leadership and unity among the tribes.
